description: After Holland, where it originally came from. From Old Dutch holt lant (“wood land”).

entries.meaning: (now historical) A type of linen cloth, originally from Holland.
examples: I am convinced that many if not all the Quality in France were shirts of the finest holand, for tho' I never saw of them strip I have seen what is an equivalent proof, I have seen on the Bulwarks of Paris above twenty entire shirts hanging to dry that the best Gentlemen in England might wear without disparagement.
